org.threadly.concurrent
Class ClockWrapper

java.lang.Object
  org.threadly.concurrent.ClockWrapper

public class ClockWrapper
extends java.lang.Object

This is a small wrapper class for Clock to avoid updating for bulk calls. This is primarily useful for the PriorityScheduledExecutor when it needs to do a binary search in a list of delayed items, or sort those delayed items. There is no reason to make a system call for each item, so we just pause getting accurate time for those fast but frequent operations.

Constructor Summary
ClockWrapper()
           
 
Method Summary
protected static long getAccurateTime()
          Returns an accurate time based on if it has been requested to stop updating from system clock temporarily or not.
protected static long getLastKnownTime()
           
protected static void resumeForcingUpdate()
          This resumes updating the clock for calls to getAccurateTime.
protected static void stopForcingUpdate()
          A call here causes getAccurateTime to use the last known time.
protected static long updateClock()
          Forces an update to the clock.
